properties.areaDesc: Chesapeake Bay from Little Creek VA to Cape Henry VA including the Chesapeake Bay Bridge Tunnel; Coastal Waters from Cape Charles Light to Virginia-North Carolina border out to 20 nm; Waters from NC VA border to Currituck Beach Light NC from 20 to 40 nm; Currituck Sound; cc; Coastal waters from NC VA border to Currituck Beach Light NC out 20 nm
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued January 14 at 5:59AM EST by NWS Wakefield VA
properties.description:
The areas affected include...

Entrance to the Chesapeake Bay including the Chesapeake Bay Bridge
Tunnel...

Coastal Waters from Cape Charles Light to the VA/NC Border out 20
NM...
Waters from Cape Charles Light to the VA/NC Border out 20 NM...
Currituck Sound...
Coastal Waters from the NC/VA Border to Currituck Beach Light NC
out 20 NM...
Waters from the NC/VA Border to Currituck Beach Light NC 20 to 40
NM...

At 558 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated a line of thunderstorms,
capable of producing winds to around 30 knots. These thunderstorms
were located along a line extending from near Lynnhaven to 12 nm
west of Knotts Island Bay, moving east at 35 knots.

strong thunderstorms will be near...
Virginia Beach Oceanfront, Rudee Inlet, Cape Henry and Sandbridge
around 605 AM EST.
Knotts Island Bay, Deal Island and 10 Nm East Of Virginia Beach
Oceanfront around 620 AM EST.
Chesapeake Light Tower around 625 AM EST.
Buoy 4a Drydocks around 635 AM EST.
Triangle Reef around 650 AM EST.
Horseshoe around 655 AM EST.
Hot Dog Area Off Virginia Beach around 700 AM EST.
properties.instruction:
Mariners can expect gusty winds to around 30 knots...locally higher
waves...and lightning strikes. Boaters should seek safe harbor
immediately until these storms pass.
